body: Looks awesome. At some stage I'll replace the heavy makefile logic with a script which iterates through each of the slots and creates them.
Nice one @mindmelting this is awesome
The log output is actually already recorded to cloudwatch
@dwmkerr Updated :)
@mindmelting to make the tests pass can you please update the names for the environment variables in CircleCI as per the README file?
Deleting this issue because there is no straightforward way to do this with the REST or GQL APIs
Probably not so useful given that we don't connect to any external services
Interesting issue with this intent @mindmelting - in this one we don't need a repo name (but of course our code demands one)... Will look and see if there is a simple way to fix this
Yes, we could have some sort of config per intent, to determine if a repo name is needed up front
This is awesome, thanks Lawrence. Well spotted with the slot version issue!
WHATS THE WORST THAT CAN HAPPEN
fixed with #92
Fixed with #92
Fixed with #92
This might be scraping the barrel ;)
Damn, looks like we still have the double issue bug. Quick question - did you have to re-enter anything? I think it might only happen when we have to re-enter a slot value
I dont think so no...
Maybe it gets kicked off twice, once on the slot being given, and then being fulfilled
Awesoooome!
